chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/4.xml

chapter.title: V. 'Bosom'd high in tufted trees.'

chapter.title: VI. 'Fare thee weel awhile!'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/6.xml

chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/8.xml

chapter.title: IX. 'Her father did fume'

chapter.title: X. 'Beneath the shelter of an aged tree.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/10.xml

chapter.title: XI. 'Journeys end in lovers meeting.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/11.xml

chapter.title: XII. 'Adieu! she cries, and waved her lily hand.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/12.xml

chapter.title: XIII. 'He set in order many proverbs.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/13.xml

chapter.title: XV. 'A wandering voice.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/15.xml

chapter.title: XVI. 'Then fancy shapes--as fancy can.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/16.xml

chapter.title: XVII. 'Her welcome, spoke in faltering phrase.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/17.xml

chapter.title: XVIII. 'He heard her musical pants.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/18.xml

chapter.title: XIX. 'Love was in the next degree.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/19.xml

chapter.title: XX. 'A distant dearness in the hill.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/20.xml

chapter.title: XXI. 'On thy cold grey stones, O sea!'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/21.xml

chapter.title: XXII. 'A woman's way.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/22.xml

chapter.title: XXIII. 'Should auld acquaintance be forgot?'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/23.xml

chapter.title: XXIV. 'Breeze, bird, and flower confess the hour.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/24.xml

chapter.title: XXV. 'Mine own familiar friend.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/25.xml

chapter.title: XXVI. 'To that last nothing under earth.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/26.xml

chapter.title: XXVII. 'How should I greet thee?'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/27.xml

chapter.title: XXVIII. 'I lull a fancy, trouble-tost.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/28.xml

chapter.title: XXIX. 'Care, thou canker.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/29.xml

chapter.title: XXX. 'Vassal unto Love.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/30.xml

chapter.title: XXXI. 'A worm i' the bud.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/31.xml

chapter.title: XXXII. 'Had I wist before I kist'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/32.xml

chapter.title: XXXIII. 'O daughter of Babylon, wasted with misery.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/33.xml

chapter.title: XXXIV. 'Yea, happy shall he be that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/34.xml

chapter.title: XXXV. 'And wilt thou leave me thus?--say nay--say nay!'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/35.xml

chapter.title: XXXVI. 'The pennie's the jewel that beautifies a'.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/36.xml

chapter.title: XXXVII. 'After many days.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/37.xml

chapter.title: XXXVIII. 'Jealousy is cruel as the grave.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/38.xml

chapter.title: XXXIX. 'Each to the loved one's side.'
chapter.location: H/Thomas Hardy/Pair of Blue Eyes, A/39.xml
